TopicTitle: How to Begin Creating a Flag?

Articles.Content:
Okay, so I know what I need to create a flag: a program like Microsoft's Paint and the ability to size down the picture, but where do I begin making one? Do I find an image on the Internet and edit it from there, or do I draw what I want? I was really hoping to create something like a hockey puck and stick for the new space program I'm opening up in 0.21, but I hardly have the creative skill do something like that.

If I wasn't clear on anything, please let me know. Thank you.

THP
draw a picture of the appropriate flag size, save it as a .PNG, plop it into the appropriate folder and you're good to go.

You've basically answered your own question. You can do whatever you want. You can google a puck and stick image and edit it with your program of choice to your hearts desire. As long as you don't distribute a modified image I am convinced nobody would mind.

Okay, thank you.

What size do they need to be, anyway?

I'm tempted to start spamming flags of catgirls everywhere.

256x160, and they need to be .png files.

OP, I'd recommend picking up GIMP. It's a good freeware image manipulator program that has a fair amount of functionality.

And for the befuddled......http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/28293-Show-off-your-flags-MEGATHREAD

GIMP

Yes, GIMP is a nice program, but if you're still starting out, it can be VERY confusing.

If you'd like to go maybe a step lower, Paint.NET is good if you use Windows.

Also, if you're using Win7, MS Paint is actually really nice now, even though the old one would have worked just fine.

Also also, flags can't support transparency, so, uh yeah, that.

I would recommend something more advanced than MS paint because it is a little of a pain. I downloads Paint.net for free and it easily formatted the flag. You can add layers of whatever image you like. My Avatar is actually my flag.
